subject: Technology
title: BlackBerry and the Business Phone
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: BlackBerry and the Business Phone.

hook.text: Before the iPhone, every executive had the same phone: a BlackBerry with a tiny physical keyboard.

buildup.text: BlackBerry pioneered mobile email. For the first time, you could read work messages away from your desk.

discovery.text: People called them 'CrackBerries' because the addiction to checking email was so intense.

twist.text: BlackBerry's CEO saw the iPhone demo and reportedly said, 'That's impossible on a phone.'

climax.text: Within five years, BlackBerry's market share collapsed from 50% to under 1% of smartphones.

punchline.text: BlackBerry invented mobile email addiction. Apple inherited it.
